title: Slovakia: four people charged over murder of investigative journalist
text:
Prosecutor files charges over 2018 killing of Ján Kuciak and his fiancee, which sparked mass protests

Slovak authorities have charged four people over the murder of an investigative journalist and his fiancee in a case that led to mass protests against high-level corruption and forced then-prime minister Robert Fico to resign.

A statement by the state prosecutor said the six charges filed over the 2018 killing of Ján Kuciak and his partner, Martina Kušnírová, included premeditated murder.

The main suspect is Márian Kočner, a politically connected entrepreneur who was a key subject of Kuciak’s reporting on corruption and cronyism in the central European country and who prosecutors believe contracted out the killing.

Kočner has denied any wrongdoing.

Kuciak and Kušnírová were gunned down in their house outside the capital, Bratislava, in February last year.

The murders shook the EU member state’s political scene, triggered protests of up to 70,000 people and forced the leftist Fico to resign in March 2018.

His three-party coalition has survived, led by Fico’s handpicked successor, Peter Pellegrini, but public anger flared again after fresh details emerged from the investigation into Kuciak’s killing indicating Kočner’s influence over state bodies.
